<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 18"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Ultimate Mercy](/Feats.aspx?ID=5929) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Champion" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=811" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 99 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetype** [Blessed One](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=242) (Level 20)

**Prerequisites**
[Mercy](/Feats.aspx?ID=5897)

</column>

---

Your mercy transcends the bounds of life and death. Add ultimate mercy to the types of mercy you can provide. When you use Mercy, you can target a creature that died since your last turn to return it to life. The target returns to life with 1 Hit Point and becomes [wounded 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=99). You can't return the target to life if it died from [_disintegrate_](/Spells.aspx?ID=1492) or a [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=571) effect. The creature gains the other benefits of _lay on hands_ after it returns to life.
